Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2009 07:42AM reen wrote: OK, now that I know I belong here, I always thought node involvement was a death sentence.  So it's REALLY good to hear from survivors.  I'm 1 year out and regret only having a lumpectomy.  Especially being my second BC.  My surgeon strongly discouraged a mast.  How about any of you?  What did you do?
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2009 06:49PM reen wrote: I'm glad you fired your surgeon.  I know what you mean about people that don't have it in their nodes. My first BC was node negative.  I only had rads.  People would say "oh you're a breast cancer survivor."  I didn't feel like one.  Second time around and having both chemo and rads, was so much harder.  I truly feel like a survivor now.  (not to down play anyone out there that only had rads.  This was my personal experience.)
Posts.Title: Stage II w/Lymph Node Involvement Warrior517 Moderators

Posts.Content: reen wrote: I know there are a lot of subjects on Lymphedema and I've read a lot, but I was wondering if anyone has had problems a year after surgery.  I had 44 nodes taken out and had a crater under my arm.  The past few weeks there seems to be swelling again.  The swelling never really went away, but now it seems more noticeable.  Like when I put my arm down, it feels weird.  There is also a pulling sensation on my upper arm underneath.  Does any of this sound familiar?  If so, what can be done to relieve it?  Is it something to worry about?  All I can think of is this swelling is cancer. First Dx. 11/2005 Mucinous Carcinoma Stage 1 Grade1 0/15 nodes Rads 2nd Dx 6/5/08, IDC, Stage 1, Grade 2, 2/44 nodes ER+ PR+ HER2- Log in to post a reply
